October 16,1954
Mr. John V. Taylor
Executive Director
Chicago Educational Television
Association
38 South Dearborn Street
Chicago 3, Illinois
Dear Mr. Taylort
I am very happy to inform your officially that the Board of Directors of the NAEB
has approved your application in behalf of the.Chicago Educational Television
Association for active membership in our association.
You Will now b® receiving regularly from us the monthly NAEB Newsletter, various
additional publications of interest as they are published, and many other items.
You should, of course, feel free to write to us at any time for any information
you would like concerning educational broadcasting. We will always try to help.
Under Separate cover we are sanding you the latest Newsletter and the NAEB Direc¬
tory of Members. Enclosed you will find a list of the materials available from
the NAEB. Please let us know which of these you would like to receive and we will
send them to you. Your certificate of membership will be sent to you soon.
Perhaps the greatest good of an NAEB membership is the associations you form. It1*
good to know that others are having the same problems you are and how they are
solving them. \ It has been the tradition with NAEB, in its thirty years as the
association of educators who broadcast, to exchange this sort of information on
a friend-to-f riend basis. You will find lots of friends in the NAEB, and lots of
people with good advice and good staff resources to supplement those which you
have.
Sincdrely,
Harry J. Skornia
